Foreign Minister meets WFP executive director 
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and had a talk with executive director of the World Food Program James T. Morris and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Nov. 14.
 Present there were an official concerned and the UN resident coordinator in the DPRK who is also representative of the WFP.

articles.title: Anecdotes about Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Honorary citizenship to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a certificate of honorary citizenship and a gift from the Canar provincial council of Ecuador.
 They were conveyed to vice-President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop by Diego Ormaza Andrade, prefect of the province, on a visit to the DPRK.    
 Written on the certificate were letters reading that the Canar provincial council decided to present respected leader Kim Jong Il, General Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, with a certificate of honorary citizenship of Canar province in recognition of his exploits performed for the emancipation of the third world people and the cause of independence.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets Italian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Paolo Bruni, Italian Ambassador to the DPRK, when he paid a farewell call on him at the mansudae assembly hall today.
 Present there were Choe Su Hon, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials concerned.

articles.title: Notice of Korea News Service
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets WFP executive director
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK met and had a friendly talk with James T. Morris, executive director of the World Food Program, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
 Present there were vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and other officials concerned and Masood Hyder, resident coordinator of the United Nations and representative of the WFP here.
